contextRef="From2013-02-20to2013-12-31" unitRef="USD" xsi:nil="true" />
<us-gaap:NatureOfOperations contextRef="From2014-01-01to2014-06-30">&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;RenovaCare, Inc., together with its wholly&#13;owned subsidiary (the
&amp;#147;Company&amp;#148;), focuses on the acquisition, research, development 
and, if warranted, commercialization&#13;of autologous (using a 
patient&amp;#146;s own cells) cellular therapies that can be used for medical 
and aesthetic applications.&#13;The Company was previously involved in the 
exploration and development of both mineral exploration properties and oil and 
gas&#13;properties.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On July 12, 2013, the 
Company, together with&#13;its wholly owned subsidiary, RenovaCare Sciences 
Corp. (&amp;#147;RenovaCare Sciences&amp;#148;), a Nevada corporation formerly 
known&#13;as Janus Acquisition Corp., entered into an asset purchase agreement 
with Dr. J&amp;#246;rg Gerlach, MD, PhD, pursuant to which 
RenovaCare&#13;Sciences purchased all of Dr. Gerlach&amp;#146;s rights, title 
and interest to a treatment methodology for skin isolation, spraying&#13;and 
associated equipment for the regeneration of human skin cells (the 
&amp;#147;Cell Deposition Device&amp;#148;), along with the associated&#13;US 
and foreign patents and patent applications. The development of the Cell 
Deposition Device is in the early stages and the Company&#13;anticipates that 
significant time and financial resources will be required to further develop the
technology and determine whether&#13;a commercially viable product can be 
developed.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The Company has recently incurred net operating&#13;losses and 
operating cash flow deficits. As of June 30, 2014, the Company&amp;#146;s total 
accumulated deficit is $6.1 million. The&#13;Company does not currently generate
revenues and will continue to incur losses from operations and operating cash 
flow deficits&#13;in the future. Management believes that the Company&amp;#146;s
cash and cash equivalent balances, anticipated cash flows from 
operations&#13;and other external sources of capital will be sufficient to meet 
the Company&amp;#146;s cash requirements through December 31, 2014.&#13;The 
future of the Company after December 2014 will depend in large part on its 
ability to successfully raise capital from external&#13;sources to fund 
operations.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:NatureOfOperations>
    <us-gaap:NatureOfOperations contextRef="From2013-01-01to2013-12-31">&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;RenovaCare,&#13;Inc., together with its wholly owned subsidiary (the 
&amp;#147;Company&amp;#148;), focuses on the acquisition, research, 
development&#13;and, if warranted, commercialization of autologous (using a 
patient&amp;#146;s own cells) cellular therapies that can be used 
for&#13;medical and aesthetic applications. The Company was previously involved 
in the exploration and development of both mineral exploration&#13;properties 
and oil and gas properties. The Company sold its oil and gas properties on 
February 18 and 19, 2013 and sold its subsidiary&#13;which controlled various 
mineral leases and mining claims on December 31, 2013. Effective February 20, 
2013, the Company became&#13;a development stage 
company.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;On&#13;July 12, 2013, the 
Company, together with its wholly owned subsidiary, RenovaCare Sciences Corp. 
(&amp;#147;RenovaCare Sciences&amp;#148;),&#13;a Nevada corporation formerly 
known as Janus Acquisition Corp., entered into an asset purchase agreement with 
Dr. J&amp;#246;rg Gerlach,&#13;MD, PhD, pursuant to which RenovaCare Sciences 
purchased all of Dr. Gerlach&amp;#146;s rights, title and interest to a 
treatment&#13;methodology for skin isolation , spraying and associated equipment
for the regeneration of human skin cells (the &amp;#147;Cell
Deposition&#13;Device&amp;#148;), along with the associated US and foreign 
patents and patent applications. The development of the Cell 
Deposition&#13;Device is in the early stages and we anticipate that significant 
time and financial resources will be required to further develop&#13;the 
technology and determine whether a commercially viable product can be 
developed.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;On&#13;December 31, 2013, we
entered into a stock purchase agreement with Duke Mountain Resources, Inc. 
(&amp;#147;Duke&amp;#148;), a Nevada&#13;corporation, pursuant to which we sold 
to Duke 100% of the issued and outstanding shares of Fostung Resources Ltd. 
(&amp;#147;Fostung&#13;Resources&amp;#148;), a corporation organized under the 
laws of Ontario, Canada and a wholly owned subsidiary of ours, for a 
promissory&#13;note in the amount of $80,000, which amount approximated the fair
value of the leases and mining claims controlled by Fostung&#13;Resources, as 
concluded by an independent third-party geological 
consultant.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0; 
text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;The Company has recently incurred&#13;net operating losses and 
operating cash flow deficits. The Company&amp;#146;s total accumulated deficit 
is $5.5 million as of December&#13;31, 2013. The Company does not currently 
generate revenues and will continue to incur losses from operations and 
operating cash&#13;flow deficits in the future. Management believes that the 
Company&amp;#146;s cash and cash equivalent balances, anticipated cash&#13;flows
from operations and other external sources of capital will be sufficient to meet
our cash requirements through December&#13;31, 2014. The future of the Company 
after December 2014 will depend in large part on its ability to successfully 
raise capital&#13;from external sources to fund 
operations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:NatureOfOperations>
    <us-gaap:BasisOfPresentationAndSignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock 
contextRef="From2014-01-01to2014-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Basis&#13;of Presentation and 
Principles of Accounting&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;The&#13;interim consolidated financial statements included herein have
been prepared by the Company, without audit, in accordance with&#13;the rules 
and regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission 
(&amp;#147;SEC&amp;#148;) pursuant to Part 210 of Regulation S-X.&#13;Certain 
information and footnote disclosures normally included in financial statements 
prepared in accordance with accounting&#13;principles generally accepted in the 
United States of America (&amp;#147;GAAP&amp;#148;) have been condensed or 
omitted pursuant to such&#13;SEC rules and regulations, although the Company 
believes that the disclosures included are adequate to make the information 
presented&#13;not misleading.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;In&#13;management&amp;#146;s opinion, the
unaudited consolidated financial statements contained herein reflect all
adjustments, consisting&#13;solely of normal recurring items, which are 
necessary for the fair presentation of the Company&amp;#146;s financial 
position, results&#13;of operations, and cash flows on a basis consistent with 
that of the Company&amp;#146;s prior audited consolidated financial 
statements.&#13;The Company has evaluated information about subsequent events 
that became available to us through the date the financial statements&#13;were 
issued. This information relates to events, transactions or changes in 
circumstances that would require us to adjust the&#13;amounts reported in the 
financial statements or to disclose information about those events, transactions
or changes in circumstances.&#13;However, the results of operations for interim 
periods may not be indicative of results to be expected for the full fiscal 
year.&#13;Therefore, these financial statements should be read in conjunction 
with the Company&amp;#146;s audited financial statements, including&#13;the 
notes thereto for the year ended December 31, 2013, which may be found under the
Company&amp;#146;s profile on EDGAR.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Principles&#13;of 
Consolidation&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;These&#13;consolidated 
financial statements have been prepared in accordance with US GAAP and include 
the accounts of the Company and its&#13;wholly owned subsidiary, RenovaCare 
Sciences. All significant intercompany transactions and balances have been 
eliminated. RenovaCare&#13;Sciences was incorporated under the laws of the State
of Nevada on June 12, 2013.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Applicable&#13;Accounting 
Guidance&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Any&#13;reference in these 
notes to applicable accounting guidance is meant to refer to the authoritative 
non-governmental US GAAP as&#13;found in the Financial Accounting Standards 
Board&amp;#146;s Accounting Standards 
Codification.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; background-color: 
white"&gt;In&#13;June 2014, the Financial Accounting Standards Board 
(&amp;#147;FASB&amp;#148;) issued Accounting Standards Update 
(&amp;#147;ASU&amp;#148;) 2014-10,&#13;Development Stage Entities (Topic 915): 
Elimination of Certain Financial Reporting Requirements. ASU 2014-10 eliminates 
the distinction&#13;of a development stage entity and certain related disclosure
requirements, including the elimination of inception-to-date information&#13;on 
the statements of operations, cash flows and stockholders&amp;#146; equity. The 
amendments in ASU 2014-10 will be effective prospectively&#13;for annual 
reporting periods beginning after December 15, 2014, and interim periods within
those annual periods, however early&#13;adoption is permitted. The Company 
adopted ASU 2014-10 during the quarter ended June 30, 2014, thereby no longer 
presenting or&#13;disclosing any information required by Topic 
915.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 9pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 9pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; background-color: white"&gt;In&#13;May 2014,
the FASB issued ASU 2014-09, Revenue from Contracts with Customers (Topic 606), 
which supersedes the revenue recognition&#13;requirements in Accounting 
Standards Codification (&amp;#147;ASC&amp;#148;) 605, Revenue Recognition. The 
new revenue recognition standard&#13;requires entities to recognize revenue in a
way that depicts the transfer of promised goods or services to customers in an 
amount&#13;that reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be 
entitled to in exchange for those goods or services. ASU 2014-09&#13;is 
effective for interim and annual reporting periods beginning after December 15, 
2016 and is to be applied retrospectively.&#13;The Company does not currently 
have any revenue. As such, ASU 2014-09 will not have any effect on the 
Company&amp;#146;s results of&#13;operations and financial position. If the 
Company begins generating revenue prior to the effective date of ASU 2014-09, it
will&#13;evaluate the effect that ASU 2014-09 will have on its results of 
operations and financial position.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
background-color: white"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Accounting&#13;Estimates&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13
;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;The&#13;preparation of consolidated financial statements in conformity
with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States&#13;of 
America requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the 
reported amounts of assets and liabilities and&#13;the reported amounts of 
revenues and expenses during the reporting period. Actual results, as determined
by future events, may&#13;differ from these 
estimates.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times,
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Cash&#13;and Cash 
Equivalents&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;The&#13;Company considers all highly liquid instruments purchased with
an original maturity of three months or less to be cash equivalents.&#13;Cash 
and cash equivalents may at times exceed federally insured 
limits.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Note&#13;Receivable
from Duke Mountain&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;The&#13;note receivable from Duke Mountain Resources, Inc. 
(&amp;#147;Duke&amp;#148;) is unsecured, bears interest at 4.0% and principal 
and interest&#13;are due on December 31, 2015. The Company&amp;#146;s credit 
risk assessment is limited due to the related party nature of the 
arrangement.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Fair&#13;Value of 
Financial Instruments&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;The&#13;carrying amounts for cash and cash equivalents and payables 
approximate fair value based on observable quoted prices for active&#13;markets 
&amp;#150; Level 1 inputs. The carrying amount of the note receivable from Duke 
approximates fair value based on similar market&#13;inputs for interest rates 
for a specific creditor &amp;#150; Level 2 
inputs.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Research&#13;and 
Development Costs&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;The&#13;Company intends to outsource its research and development 
efforts and expense related costs as incurred, including the cost 
of&#13;manufacturing product for testing, licensing fees and costs associated 
with planning and conducting clinical trials. The value&#13;ascribed to patents 
and other intellectual property acquired will be capitalized as it relates to 
particular research and development&#13;projects that may have alternative 
future uses.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Intangible&#13;Assets&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#
13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align:
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;The&#13;intangible asset consists primarily of Cell Deposition Device 
technology that the Company acquired during 2013 and is recorded&#13;at cost. At
the time of acquisition the technology had not reached technological 
feasibility. The amount capitalized is accounted&#13;for as an indefinite-lived 
intangible asset, subject to impairment testing until completion or abandonment.
Upon successful completion,&#13;a determination will be made as to the then
useful life of the intangible asset, generally determined by the period in which
substantially&#13;all of the cash flows are expected to be generated, and begin 
amortization. The Company tests the intangible asset for impairment&#13;at least
annually or more frequently if impairment indicators exist after performing a 
qualitative analysis. Management has multiple&#13;criteria that it considers 
when performing the qualitative analysis. The results of this review are then 
weighed and prioritized.&#13;If the totality of the relevant events and 
circumstances indicate that it is not more likely than not that the fair value 
of the&#13;intangible asset is less than its carrying amount, additional 
impairment tests are not necessary.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;Company assessed the
following qualitative factors that could affect any change in the fair value of 
the intangible asset: analysis&#13;of the technology&amp;#146;s current phase, 
additional testing necessary to bring the technology to market, development of 
competing&#13;products, changes in projections caused by delays, changes in 
regulations, changes in the market for the technology and changes&#13;in cost 
projections to bring the technology to market. Based on a qualitative 
assessment, management concluded that a positive&#13;assertion can be made from 
the qualitative assessment that it is not more likely than not that the fair 
value of the intangible&#13;asset is less than its carrying 
amount.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Stock&#13;Options&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&
lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;The&#13;Company measures all stock-based compensation awards using a 
fair value method on the date of grant and recognizes such expense&#13;in its 
consolidated financial statements over the requisite service period. The Company
uses the Black-Scholes pricing model to&#13;determine the fair value of stock-
based compensation awards on the date of grant. The Black-Scholes pricing model 
requires management&#13;to make assumptions regarding option lives, expected 
volatility, and risk free interest rates.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Income&#13;Taxes&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&l
t;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;The&#13;Company recognizes income taxes on an accrual basis based on 
tax positions taken, or expected to be taken, in tax returns.
 A tax&#13;position is defined as a position in a previously filed tax return or
a position expected to be taken in future tax filing that&#13;is reflected in 
measuring current or deferred income tax assets and liabilities. Tax positions 
are recognized only when it is&#13;more likely than not (i.e., likelihood of 
greater than 50%), based on technical merits, that the position would be 
sustained upon&#13;examination by taxing authorities. Tax positions that meet 
the more likely than not threshold are measured using a probability-
weighted&#13;approach as the largest amount of tax benefit that is greater than
50% likely of being realized upon settlement. Income taxes&#13;are accounted for
using an asset and liability approach that requires the recognition of deferred 
tax assets and liabilities for&#13;the expected future tax consequences of 
events that have been recognized in the Company&amp;#146;s financial statements 
or tax returns.&#13;A valuation allowance is established to reduce deferred tax 
assets if all, or some portion, of such assets will more than likely&#13;not be 
realized. Should they occur, the Company&amp;#146;s policy is to classify 
interest and penalties related to tax positions as&#13;interest expense. Since 
the Company&amp;#146;s inception, no such interest or penalties have been 
incurred. The Company did not record&#13;an income tax provision during the 
periods presented due to net taxable 
losses.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Discontinued&#13;Operations&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&
#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;The&#13;results of the Company&amp;#146;s oil and gas and mineral 
assets are being reported as discontinued operations as a result of the&#13;sale
of the oil and gas properties in February 2013 and the sale of the 
Company&amp;#146;s subsidiary which controlled various mineral&#13;leases and 
claims in December 2013. Certain amounts reported in the prior periods presented
have been reclassified to conform&#13;to the current period financial statement 
presentation. These reclassifications have no effect on previously reported net 
income&#13;(loss).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Earnings&#13;(Loss) Per 
Share&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;The&#13;Company presents both basic and diluted earnings per share 
(&amp;#147;EPS&amp;#148;) amounts. Basic EPS is calculated by dividing 
net&#13;income (loss) by the weighted average number of common shares 
outstanding during the period presented. Diluted EPS amounts are&#13;based upon 
the weighted average number of common and common equivalent shares outstanding 
during the period presented. Potentially&#13;dilutive shares of common stock 
consisted of warrants to purchase shares of common stock (8,200,000 shares as of
June 30, 2014&#13;and December 31, 2013) and options to purchase shares of 
common stock (135,000 shares as of June 30, 2014 and 80,000 as of 
December&#13;31, 2013). During the periods presented, potentially dilutive 
shares of common stock were not included in the computation of dilutive&#13;loss
per share as to do so would be anti-
dilutive.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Related&#13;Party 
Transactions&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;A&#13;related party is generally defined as (i) any person who holds 
10% or more of the Company&amp;#146;s securities and their 
immediate&#13;families; (ii) the Company&amp;#146;s management; (iii) someone 
who directly or indirectly controls, is controlled by or is under&#13;common 
control with the Company; or (iv) anyone who can significantly influence the 
financial and operating decisions of the Company.&#13;A transaction is 
considered to be a related party transaction when there is a transfer of 
resources or obligations between related&#13;parties. See &amp;#147;Note 6. 
Related Party Transactions,&amp;#148; for further 
discussion.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Comprehensive 
Income (Loss)&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The 
Company has no items of other comprehensive&#13;income in any period 
presented.&amp;#160; Therefore, net loss equals comprehensive 
loss.&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:BasisOfPresentationAndSignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:BasisOfPresentationAndSignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock 
contextRef="From2013-01-01to2013-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Basis&#13;of Presentation and 
Principles of Accounting&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;As&#13;the Company is 
devoting substantially all of its efforts to establishing a new business, and 
while planned principal operations&#13;have commenced, there has been no revenue
generated from sales, license fees or royalties, and as such, the Company is 
considered&#13;a development stage company. Accordingly, the Company&amp;#146;s 
consolidated financial statements are presented in accordance 
with&#13;authoritative accounting guidance related to a development stage 
enterprise.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Principles&#13;of 
Consolidation&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;These&#13;consolidated 
financial statements have been prepared in accordance with US GAAP and include 
the accounts of the Company and its&#13;wholly owned subsidiary, RenovaCare 
Sciences. All significant intercompany transactions and balances have been 
eliminated. RenovaCare&#13;Sciences was incorporated under the laws of the State
of Nevada on June 12, 2013.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Applicable&#13;Accounting 
Guidance&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Any&#13;reference in these 
notes to applicable accounting guidance is meant to refer to the authoritative 
non-governmental US GAAP as&#13;found in the Financial Accounting Standards 
Board&amp;#146;s Accounting Standards 
Codification.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Accounting&#13;Estimates&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13
;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;preparation of 
consolidated financial statements in conformity with accounting principles 
generally accepted in the United States&#13;of America requires management to 
make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and 
liabilities and&#13;the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the 
reporting period. Actual results, as determined by future events, may&#13;differ
from these estimates.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Cash&#13;and Cash 
Equivalents&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;Company considers 
all highly liquid instruments purchased with an original maturity of three 
months or less to be cash equivalents.&#13;Cash and cash equivalents may at 
times exceed federally insured limits.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Note&#13;Receivable
from Duke Mountain&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;note receivable from
Duke Mountain is unsecured, bears interest at 4.0%, and principal and interest 
are due on December 31, 2015.&#13;The Company&amp;#146;s credit risk assessment 
is limited due to the related party nature of the 
arrangement.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Fair&#13;Value of
Financial Instruments&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;carrying amounts for
cash and cash equivalents, and payables approximate fair value based on 
observable quoted prices for active&#13;markets &amp;#150; Level 1 inputs. The 
carrying amount of the note receivable from Duke Mountain approximates fair 
value based on&#13;observable market inputs for interest rates &amp;#150; Level 
2 inputs.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Research&#13;and 
Development Costs&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;Company intends to 
outsource its research and development efforts and expense related costs as 
incurred, including the cost of&#13;manufacturing product for testing, licensing
fees and costs associated with planning and conducting clinical trials. The 
value&#13;ascribed to patents and other intellectual property acquired will be 
capitalized as it relates to particular research and development&#13;projects 
that may have alternative future uses.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Intangible&#13;Assets&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#
13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align:
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font
 style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;intangible asset 
consists primarily of Cell Deposition Device technology that the Company 
acquired during 2013 and is recorded&#13;at cost. At the time of acquisition, 
the technology had not reached technological feasibility. The amount capitalized
is accounted&#13;for as an indefinite-lived intangible asset, subject to 
impairment testing until completion or abandonment. Upon successful 
completion,&#13;a determination will be made as to the then useful life of the 
intangible asset, generally determined by the period in which 
substantially&#13;all of the cash flows are expected to be generated, and begin 
amortization. The Company tests the intangible asset for impairment&#13;at least
annually or more frequently if impairment indicators exist after performing a 
qualitative analysis. Management has multiple&#13;criteria that it considers 
when performing the qualitative analysis. The results of this review are then 
weighed and prioritized.&#13;If the totality of the relevant events and 
circumstances indicate that it is not more likely than not that the fair value 
of the&#13;intangible asset is less than its carrying amount, additional 
impairment tests are not necessary.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;Company assessed the
following qualitative factors that could affect any change in the fair value of 
the intangible asset: analysis&#13;of the technology&amp;#146;s current phase, 
additional testing necessary to bring the technology to market, development of 
competing&#13;products, changes in projections caused by delays, changes in
regulations, changes in the market for the technology and changes&#13;in cost 
projections to bring the technology to market. Based on a qualitative 
assessment, management concluded that a positive&#13;assertion can be made from 
the qualitative assessment that it is not more likely than not that the fair 
value of the intangible&#13;asset is less than its carrying 
amount.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Stock&#13;Options&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&
lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;Company measures all
stock-based compensation awards using a fair value method on the date of grant 
and recognizes such expense&#13;in its consolidated financial statements over 
the requisite service period. The Company uses the Black-Scholes pricing model 
to&#13;determine the fair value of stock-based compensation awards on the date 
of grant. The Black-Scholes pricing model requires management&#13;to make 
assumptions regarding option lives, expected volatility, and risk free interest 
rates.&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Income&#13;Taxes&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&l
t;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;Company recognizes 
income taxes on an accrual basis based on tax positions taken, or expected to be
taken, in tax returns. A tax&#13;position is defined as a position in a 
previously filed tax return or a position expected to be taken in future tax 
filing that&#13;is reflected in measuring current or deferred income tax assets 
and liabilities. Tax positions are recognized only when it is&#13;more likely 
than not (i.e., likelihood of greater than 50%), based on technical merits, that
the position would be sustained upon&#13;examination by taxing authorities. Tax 
positions that meet the more likely than not threshold are measured using a 
probability-weighted&#13;approach as the largest amount of tax benefit that is 
greater than 50% likely of being realized upon settlement. Income taxes&#13;are 
accounted for using an asset and liability approach that requires the 
recognition of deferred tax assets and liabilities for&#13;the expected future 
tax consequences of events that have been recognized in our financial statements
or tax returns. A valuation&#13;allowance is established to reduce deferred tax 
assets if all, or some portion, of such assets will more than likely not be 
realized.&#13;No provision for income taxes was recorded during the periods 
presented because the Company had a net taxable loss. Should they&#13;occur, our
policy is to classify interest and penalties related to tax positions as 
interest expense. Since our inception, no&#13;such interest or penalties have 
been incurred.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Discontinued&#13;Operations&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&
#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;assets and financial
results of the Company&amp;#146;s oil and gas and mineral assets are being 
reported as discontinued operations&#13;as a result of the sale of the oil and 
gas properties in February 2013 and the sale of the Company&amp;#146;s 
subsidiary which controlled&#13;various mineral leases and claims in December 
2013. Certain amounts reported in the prior periods presented have been 
reclassified&#13;to conform to the current period financial statement 
presentation. These reclassifications have no effect on previously 
reported&#13;net income (loss). See &amp;#147;Note 3. Discontinued 
Operations&amp;#148; for a summary of the amounts reclassified for the 
periods&#13;presented herein.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Earnings&#13;(Loss)
Per Share&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;Company presents 
both basic and diluted earnings per share (&amp;#147;EPS&amp;#148;) amounts. 
Basic EPS is calculated by dividing net&#13;income (loss) by the weighted 
average number of common shares outstanding during the period presented. Diluted
EPS amounts are&#13;based upon the weighted average number of common and common 
equivalent shares outstanding during the period presented. 
Potentially&#13;dilutive shares of common stock consisted of warrants to 
purchase shares of common stock (8,200,000 shares for 2013 and nil 
shares&#13;for 2012) and options to purchase shares of common stock (80,000 
shares for 2013 and nil shares for 2012). During the periods&#13;presented, 
potentially dilutive shares of common stock were not included in the computation
of dilutive loss per share as to do&#13;so would be anti-
dilutive.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Comprehensive&#13;Income 
(Loss)&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Comprehensive&#13;loss
 is comprised of net loss,and a reclassification on disposal of subsidiary for 
the periods presented.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Related&#13;Party 
Transactions&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;A&#13;related party is 
generally defined as (i) any person who holds 10% or more of the 
Company&amp;#146;s securities and their immediate&#13;families; (ii) the 
Company&amp;#146;s management; (iii) someone who directly or indirectly 
controls, is controlled by or is under&#13;common control with the Company; or
(iv) anyone who can significantly influence the financial and operating 
decisions of the Company.&#13;A transaction is considered to be a related party 
transaction when there is a transfer of resources or obligations between 
related&#13;parties. See &amp;#147;Note 7. Related Party Transactions,&amp;#148;
for further discussion.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:BasisOfPresentationAndSignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock 
contextRef="From2014-01-01to2014-06-30">&lt;p style="margin: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On August 1, 2013, the Company engaged
Vector&#13;to assist the Company with identifying subject matter experts in the 
medical device and biotechnology industries and to assist&#13;the Company with 
its ongoing research, development and eventual commercialization of its 
Regeneration Technology (collectively,&#13;the &amp;#147;Services&amp;#148;). In
consideration of the Services, the Company will pay Vector a monthly consulting 
fee of $5,000.&#13;The consulting agreement with Vector continues until December
31, 2014, unless earlier terminated by either party upon 5 days 
prior&#13;written notice.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In connection with the 
Company&amp;#146;s anticipated&#13;Section 510(k) submission of its proprietary 
Cell Deposition Device to the Food and Drug Administration, the Company has 
engaged&#13;StemCell System GmbH (&amp;#147;StemCell Systems&amp;#148;) to 
provide it with prototypes and related documents. The Company received&#13;a 
purchase order from StemCell Systems in the amount of $130,000, for which 
$65,000 was paid in the three months ended June 30,&#13;2014. The remaining 
payments are due prior to December 31, 2014, the exact timing of which is 
dependent on when the work is performed.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent:
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman,

Agreement&amp;#148;) with&#13;Ms. Janet Bien, pursuant to which Ms. Bien was to 
serve as the Company&amp;#146;s Chief Financial Officer. Pursuant to the Bien 
Services&#13;Agreement, Ms. Bien was to provide the Company with services 
consistent with that of a Chief Financial Officer on a part-time&#13;basis, for 
which she was to be paid a monthly fee of $2,400 and was to be reimbursed for 
any business related expenses. The Bien&#13;Services Agreement was terminable by
either the Company or Ms. Bien upon written notice with or without cause. The 
Bien Services&#13;Agreement was terminated effective as of September 30, 
2013.&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times

payable&#13;in equal yearly installments in arrears and prorated for any partial
years of service. Additionally, subject to their entering&#13;into a non-
statutory stock option agreement with us, Dr. Kirkland and Mr. Sierchio were 
each issued incentive stock options to&#13;purchase up to 20,000 shares of the 
Company&amp;#146;s common stock at an exercise price of $0.65 per share, the 
closing price of&#13;the Company&amp;#146;s common stock as quoted on the OTC 
Markets Group Inc. QB tier (the &amp;#147;OTCQB&amp;#148;) on July 31, 2013, 
pursuant&#13;to the Incentive Plan. Subject to their continued service as a 
member of the Board, 10,000 of the option shares vest immediately&#13;and 10,000
of the option shares vest on the first anniversary of date of 
grant.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman,

style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Effective&#13;September 30, 
2013, Ms. Rosen resigned as President and Chief Executive Officer and the 
Company entered into an At-Will Executive&#13;Services Agreement (the 
&amp;#147;Rosen Services Agreement&amp;#148;), pursuant to which Ms. Rosen will 
serve as the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;Chief Financial Officer. Pursuant to the 
Rosen Services Agreement, Ms. Rosen will provide the Company with services 
consistent&#13;with that of a Chief Financial Officer on a part-time basis, for 
which she will be paid a monthly fee of $2,400 and will be reimbursed&#13;for 
any business related expenses. The Rosen Services Agreement is terminable by 
either the Company or Ms. Rosen upon advance&#13;written 
notice.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;On&#13;November 29, 2013, 
the Company entered into a subscription agreement with Kalen Capital Corporation
(the &amp;#147;Investor&amp;#148;),&#13;a private Alberta corporation wholly 
owned by Mr. Harmel S. Rayat and a majority shareholder of the 
Company&amp;#146;s, pursuant&#13;to which the Investor purchased 3,500,000 Units
at a purchase price of $0.43 per Unit, for an aggregate purchase amount of 
$1,505,000.&#13;Each Unit consists of: (a) one share of common stock; (b) one 
Series B Warrant exercisable for one share of Common Stock at an&#13;exercise 
price of $0.43 per share if exercised within the first eighteen months or $0.46 
per share if exercised after the first&#13;eighteen months and prior to 
expiration on November 29, 2018; and (c) one Series C Warrant exercisable for 
one share of common&#13;stock at an exercise price of $0.43 per share if 
exercised within the first eighteen months or $0.49 per share if exercised 
after&#13;the first eighteen months and prior to expiration on November 29, 
2018. Each of the Series B Warrant and Series C Warrant contains&#13;a provision
allowing the holder to exercise the respective warrant on a cashless basis as 
further set forth therein. The Unit&#13;price of $0.43 represents a 30% discount
to the 20 day average closing price of the Common Stock as quoted on the OTCQB 
as of&#13;October 31, 2013, the last trading date prior to us entering into a 
non-binding term sheet with the Investor regarding the purchase&#13;of the 
Units.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt

style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;On&#13;December 1, 2013, the
Company appointed Mr. Bold as its President &amp;#38; CEO and entered into the 
Consulting Agreement with Mr.&#13;Bold. Pursuant to the terms of the Consulting 
Agreement, Mr. Bold is expected to serve on a part-time basis and will receive 
an&#13;annual fee of $50,000, payable in 12 equal installments, which is 
prorated for any partial months during the term of the Consulting&#13;Agreement.
In addition to Mr. Bold&amp;#146;s fee, he was issued Option Shares to purchase 
up to 40,000 shares of the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;common stock at a price of 
$0.75 per share the closing price of the Company&amp;#146;s common stock as 
quoted on the OTCQB on November&#13;29, 2013. The Options Shares may be 
exercised on a cashless basis using the formula contained therein and, subject 
to Mr. Bold&amp;#146;s&#13;continued service as the Company&amp;#146;s President
and Chief Executive Officer, vest as follows, 20,000 Options Shares on: 
(a)&#13;December 1, 2014; and (b) December 1, 
2015.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;On&#13;December 31, 2013, 
the Company completed the sale of 100% of the issued and outstanding shares of 
Fostung Resources to Duke for&#13;a promissory note in the amount of $80,000, 
which amount approximated the fair value of the leases and mining claims 
controlled&#13;by Fostung Resources, as concluded by an independent third-party 
geological consultant. Principal and interest at 4.0% are payable&#13;on 
December 31, 2015. Mr. Herdev S. Rayat, the majority shareholder of Duke, is the
brother of Mr. Harmel S. Rayat, the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;majority 
shareholder.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New

Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;On&#13;April 1, 2014, the 
Company appointed Ms. Patsy Trisler as its Vice President &amp;#150; Clinical 
&amp;#38; Regulatory Affairs and entered&#13;into the Trisler Consulting 
Agreement with Ms. Trisler. Pursuant to the terms of the Trisler Consulting 
Agreement, Ms. Trisler&#13;will receive a monthly fee of $5,000, which covers 
her services for up to 40 hours in any given month and will pay her an 
hourly&#13;fee of $125 for every hour in excess of forty, prorated for any 
partial hour. The Consulting Agreement may be terminated at any&#13;time by 
either Ms. Trisler or the Company. In addition to Ms. Trisler&amp;#146;s fee, 
she was issued Option Shares to purchase up&#13;to 50,000 shares of the 
Company&amp;#146;s common stock at a price of $1.05 per share, the closing price
of the Company&amp;#146;s common&#13;stock as quoted on the OTCQB on March 31, 
2014. The Options Shares may be exercised on a &amp;#147;cashless 
basis&amp;#148; using the&#13;formula contained therein and, subject to Ms. 
Trisler&amp;#146;s continued service as the Company&amp;#146;s Vice President 
&amp;#150;&#13;Clinical &amp;#38; Regulatory Affairs, vest as follows, 10,000 
Options Shares on: (a) April 1, 2015; (b) April 1, 2016; (c) April&#13;1, 2017; 
(d) April 1, 2018; and (e) April 1, 2019.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify;
text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;On&#13;April 20, 2014, the Company appointed Andrew Danielson as its 
Director of Business Development at an annual salary of $60,000.&#13;In addition
Mr. Danielson was issued Option Shares to purchase 5,000 shares of the 
Company&amp;#146;s common stock at a price of&#13;$1.05 per share, the closing 
price of the Company&amp;#146;s common stock as quoted on the OTCQB on April 17,
2014. The Options Shares&#13;may be exercised on a &amp;#147;cashless 
basis&amp;#148; using the formula contained therein and, subject to Mr. 
Danielson&amp;#146;s continued&#13;service with the Company. The Options Shares 
vest on April 20, 2015.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,

style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;For&#13;the three months 
ended June 30, 2014, directors&amp;#146; and management fees, consulting fees 
and reimbursement of expenses paid&#13;to officers and directors of the Company 
were $3,000 (2013: $0). For the&amp;#160;six months

fees and reimbursement of expenses paid to officers and directors of the Company
was $6,000 (2013:&#13;$0). Legal fees paid to one of the Company&amp;#146;s 
directors in the three months ended June 30, 2014 were $27,820 (2013: 
$38,974).&#13;Legal fees paid to one of the Company&amp;#146;s directors in 
the&amp;#160;six months ended June 30, 2014 were $82,185 (2013:

Company can make available an alternative medical insurance

exercise price of $0.72 per share, previously issued to Ms. Rosen, were 
forfeited effective September 30, 2013.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p

corporation wholly owned by Mr.&#13;Harmel Rayat and a majority shareholder of 
ours, pursuant to which the Investor purchased 3,500,000 Units at a purchase 
price&#13;of $0.43 per Unit, for an aggregate purchase amount of $1,505,000. 
Each Unit consists of: (a) one share of Common Stock; (b) one&#13;Series B 
Warrant exercisable for one share of Common Stock at an exercise price of $0.43 
per share if exercised within the first&#13;eighteen months or $0.46 per share 
if exercised after the first eighteen months and prior to expiration on November
29, 2018;&#13;and (c) one Series C Warrant exercisable for one share of Common 
Stock at an exercise price of $0.43 per share if exercised within&#13;the first 
eighteen months or $0.49 per share if exercised after the first eighteen months 
and prior to expiration on November&#13;29, 2018. Each of the Series B Warrant 
and Series C Warrant contains a provision allowing the holder to exercise the 
respective&#13;warrant on a cashless basis as further set forth therein. The 
Unit price of $0.43 represents a 30% discount to the 20 day average&#13;closing 
price of the Common Stock as quoted on the OTCQB as of October 31, 2013, the 
last trading date prior to us entering into&#13;a non-binding term sheet with 
the Investor regarding the purchase of the 
Units.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman,

    <us-gaap:BasisOfAccountingPolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2014-01-
01to2014-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0; text-align: justify"&gt;The interim consolidated financial 
statements&#13;included herein have been prepared by the Company, without audit,
in accordance with the rules and regulations of the Securities&#13;and Exchange 
Commission (&amp;#147;SEC&amp;#148;) pursuant to Part 210 of Regulation S-X. 
Certain information and footnote disclosures&#13;normally included in financial 
statements prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted 
in the United States&#13;of America (&amp;#147;GAAP&amp;#148;) have been 
condensed or omitted pursuant to such SEC rules and regulations, although the 
Company&#13;believes that the disclosures included are adequate to make the 
information presented not misleading.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In management&amp;#146;s
opinion, the unaudited&#13;consolidated financial statements contained herein 
reflect all adjustments, consisting solely of normal recurring items, 
which&#13;are necessary for the fair presentation of the Company&amp;#146;s 
financial position, results of operations, and cash flows on a 
basis&#13;consistent with that of the Company&amp;#146;s prior audited 
consolidated financial statements. The Company has evaluated 
information&#13;about subsequent events that became available to us through the 
date the financial statements were issued. This information relates&#13;to 
events, transactions or changes in circumstances that would require us to adjust
the amounts reported in the financial statements&#13;or to disclose information 
about those events, transactions or changes in circumstances. However, the 
results of operations for&#13;interim periods may not be indicative of results 
to be expected for the full fiscal year. Therefore, these financial 
statements&#13;should be read in conjunction with the Company&amp;#146;s audited
financial statements, including the notes thereto for the year 
ended&#13;December 31, 2013, which may be found under the Company&amp;#146;s 
profile on EDGAR.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:BasisOfAccountingPolicyPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:BasisOfAccountingPolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2013-01-
01to2013-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;As&#13;the Company is devoting substantially all of its efforts to 
establishing a new business, and while planned principal operations&#13;have 
commenced, there has been no revenue generated from sales, license fees or 
royalties, and as such, the Company is considered&#13;a development stage 
company. Accordingly, the Company&amp;#146;s consolidated financial statements 
are presented in accordance with&#13;authoritative accounting guidance related 
to a development stage enterprise.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:BasisOfAccountingPolicyPolicyTextBlock>

    <rcar:AccountingStandardsCodificationPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2014-
01-01to2014-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Any reference in these notes to 
applicable&#13;accounting guidance is meant to refer to the authoritative non-
governmental US GAAP as found in the Financial Accounting 
Standards&#13;Board&amp;#146;s Accounting Standards 
Codification.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="background-color: white"&gt;In June&#13;2014, the 
Financial Accounting Standards Board (&amp;#147;FASB&amp;#148;) issued 
Accounting Standards Update (&amp;#147;ASU&amp;#148;) 2014-10,&#13;Development 
Stage Entities (Topic 915): Elimination of Certain Financial Reporting 
Requirements. ASU 2014-10 eliminates the distinction&#13;of a development stage 
entity and certain related disclosure requirements, including the elimination of
inception-to-date information&#13;on the statements of operations, cash flows 
and stockholders&amp;#146; equity. The amendments in ASU 2014-10 will be 
effective prospectively&#13;for annual reporting periods beginning after 
December 15, 2014, and interim periods within those annual periods, however 
early&#13;adoption is permitted. The Company adopted ASU 2014-10 during the 
quarter ended June 30, 2014, thereby no longer presenting or&#13;disclosing any 
information required by Topic 915.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="background-color: white"&gt;In May&#13;2014, the FASB issued ASU 2014-09,
Revenue from Contracts with Customers (Topic 606), which supersedes the revenue 
recognition&#13;requirements in Accounting Standards Codification 
(&amp;#147;ASC&amp;#148;) 605, Revenue Recognition. The new revenue recognition 
standard&#13;requires entities to recognize revenue in a way that depicts the 
transfer of promised goods or services to customers in an amount&#13;that 
reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled to in 
exchange for those goods or services. ASU 2014-09&#13;is effective for interim 
and annual reporting periods beginning after December 15, 2016 and is to be 
applied retrospectively. The&#13;Company does not currently have any revenue. As
such, ASU 2014-09 will not have any effect on the Company&amp;#146;s results of 
operations&#13;and financial position. If the Company begins generating revenue 
prior to the effective date of ASU 2014-09, it will evaluate the&#13;effect that
ASU 2014-09 will have on its results of operations and financial 
position.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</rcar:AccountingStandardsCodificationPolicyText
Block>
    <rcar:AccountingStandardsCodificationPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2013-
01-01to2013-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;Any&#13;reference in these notes to applicable accounting 
guidance is meant to refer to the authoritative non-governmental US GAAP 
as&#13;found in the Financial Accounting Standards Board&amp;#146;s Accounting 
Standards 
Codification.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</rcar:AccountingStandardsCodificationPolicy
TextBlock>
<us-gaap:UseOfEstimates contextRef="From2014-01-01to2014-06-30">&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The preparation of consolidated financial statements&#13;in 
conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of
America requires management to make estimates&#13;and assumptions that affect 
the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and the reported amounts of 
revenues and expenses during&#13;the reporting period. Actual results, as 
determined by future events, may differ from these estimates.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:UseOfEstimates>
    <us-gaap:UseOfEstimates contextRef="From2013-01-01to2013-12-31">&lt;p

reported amounts of assets and liabilities and&#13;the reported amounts of 
revenues and expenses during the reporting period. Actual results, as determined

estimates.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:UseOfEstimates>

    <us-gaap:FairValueOfFinancialInstrumentsPolicy contextRef="From2014-01-
01to2014-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0; text-align: justify"&gt;The carrying amounts for cash and 
cash&#13;equivalents and payables approximate fair value based on observable 
quoted prices for active markets &amp;#150; Level 1 inputs.&#13;The carrying 
amount of the note receivable from Duke approximates fair value based on similar
market inputs for interest&#13;rates for a specific creditor -  Level 2 
inputs.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:FairValueOfFinancialInstrumentsPolicy>
    <us-gaap:FairValueOfFinancialInstrumentsPolicy contextRef="From2013-01-
01to2013-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0pt"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;carrying amounts for cash and cash 
equivalents, and payables approximate fair value based on observable quoted 
prices for inactive&#13;markets &amp;#150; Level 1 inputs. The carrying amount 
of the note receivable from Duke Mountain approximates fair value based 
on&#13;observable market inputs for interest rates &amp;#150; Level 2 
inputs.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:FairValueOfFinancialInstrumentsPolicy>
<us-gaap:InProcessResearchAndDevelopmentPolicy contextRef="From2014-01-
01to2014-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company intends to outsource its research&#13;and
development efforts and expense related costs as incurred, including the cost of
manufacturing product for testing, licensing&#13;fees and costs associated with 
planning and conducting clinical trials. The value ascribed to patents and other
intellectual property&#13;acquired will be capitalized as it relates to 
particular research and development projects that may have alternative future 
uses.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:InProcessResearchAndDevelopmentPolicy>
    <us-gaap:InProcessResearchAndDevelopmentPolicy contextRef="From2013-01-
