efforts and expense related costs as incurred, including the cost 
of&#13;manufacturing product for testing, licensing fees and costs associated 
with planning and conducting clinical trials. The value&#13;ascribed to patents 
and other intellectual property acquired will be capitalized as it relates to 
particular research and development&#13;projects that may have alternative 
future uses.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:InProcessResearchAndDevelopmentPolicy>
    <us-gaap:GoodwillAndIntangibleAssetsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2014-01-
01to2014-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0; text-align: justify"&gt;The intangible asset consists primarily of&#13;Cell 
Deposition Device technology that the Company acquired during 2013 and is 
recorded at cost. At the time of acquisition the&#13;technology had not reached 
technological feasibility. The amount capitalized is accounted for as an 
indefinite-lived intangible&#13;asset, subject to impairment testing until 
completion or abandonment. Upon successful completion, a determination will be 
made&#13;as to the then useful life of the intangible asset, generally 
determined by the period in which substantially all of the cash flows&#13;are 
expected to be generated, and begin amortization. The Company tests the 
intangible asset for impairment at least annually or&#13;more frequently if 
impairment indicators exist after performing a qualitative analysis. Management 
has multiple criteria that it&#13;considers when performing the qualitative 
analysis. The results of this review are then weighed and prioritized. If the 
totality&#13;of the relevant events and circumstances indicate that it is not 
more likely than not that the fair value of the intangible asset&#13;is less 
than its carrying amount, additional impairment tests are not 
necessary.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The Company assessed the following qualitative&#13;factors that 
could affect any change in the fair value of the intangible asset: analysis of 
the technology&amp;#146;s current phase,&#13;additional testing necessary to 
bring the technology to market, development of competing products, changes in 
projections caused&#13;by delays, changes in regulations, changes in the market 
for the technology and changes in cost projections to bring the 
technology&#13;to market. Based on a qualitative assessment, management 
concluded that a positive assertion can be made from the qualitative 
assessment&#13;that it is not more likely than not that the fair value of the 
intangible asset is less than its carrying amount.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:GoodwillAndIntangibleAssetsPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:GoodwillAndIntangibleAssetsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2013-01-
01to2013-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;The&#13;intangible asset consists primarily of Cell Deposition Device 
technology that the Company acquired during 2013 and is recorded&#13;at cost. At
the time of acquisition, the technology had not reached technological 
feasibility. The amount capitalized is accounted&#13;for as an indefinite-lived 
intangible asset, subject to impairment testing until completion or abandonment.
Upon successful completion,&#13;a determination will be made as to the then 
useful life of the intangible asset, generally determined by the period in which
substantially&#13;all of the cash flows are expected to be generated, and begin 
amortization. The Company tests the intangible asset for impairment&#13;at least
annually or more frequently if impairment indicators exist after performing a 
qualitative analysis. Management has multiple&#13;criteria that it considers 
when performing the qualitative analysis. The results of this review are then 
weighed and prioritized.&#13;If the totality of the relevant events and 
circumstances indicate that it is not more likely than not that the fair value 
of the&#13;intangible asset is less than its carrying amount, additional 
impairment tests are not necessary.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify;
text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;Company assessed the
following qualitative factors that could affect any change in the fair value of 
the intangible asset: analysis&#13;of the technology&amp;#146;s current phase, 
additional testing necessary to bring the technology to market, development of 
competing&#13;products, changes in projections caused by delays, changes in 
regulations, changes in the market for the technology and changes&#13;in cost 
projections to bring the technology to market. Based on a qualitative 
assessment, management concluded that a positive&#13;assertion can be made from 
the qualitative assessment that it is not more likely than not that the fair 
value of the intangible&#13;asset is less than its carrying 
amount.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:GoodwillAndIntangibleAssetsPolicyTextBlock>
    <rcar:StockOptionsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2014-01-01to2014-06-
30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;The Company measures all stock-based compensation&#13;awards 
using a fair value method on the date of grant and recognizes such expense in 
its consolidated financial statements over&#13;the requisite service period. The
Company uses the Black-Scholes pricing model to determine the fair value of 
stock-based compensation&#13;awards on the date of grant. The Black-Scholes 
pricing model requires management to make assumptions regarding option lives, 
expected&#13;volatility, and risk free interest 
rates.&lt;/p&gt;</rcar:StockOptionsPolicyTextBlock>
    <rcar:StockOptionsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2013-01-01to2013-12-
31">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;The&#13;Company measures all stock-based compensation awards using a 
fair value method on the date of grant and recognizes such expense&#13;in its 
consolidated financial statements over the requisite service period. The Company
uses the Black-Scholes pricing model to&#13;determine the fair value of stock-
based compensation awards on the date of grant. The Black-Scholes pricing model 
requires management&#13;to make assumptions regarding option lives, expected 
volatility, and risk free interest 
rates.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</rcar:StockOptionsPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2014-01-01to2014-06-
30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;The Company recognizes income taxes on an accrual&#13;basis 
based on tax positions taken, or expected to be taken, in tax returns. A tax 
position is defined as a position in a previously&#13;filed tax return or a 
position expected to be taken in future tax filing that is reflected in 
measuring current or deferred income&#13;tax assets and liabilities. Tax 
positions are recognized only when it is more likely than not (i.e., likelihood 
of greater than&#13;50%), based on technical merits, that the position would be 
sustained upon examination by taxing authorities. Tax positions that&#13;meet 
the more likely than not threshold are measured using a probability-weighted 
approach as the largest amount of tax benefit&#13;that is greater than 50% 
likely of being realized upon settlement. Income taxes are accounted for using 
an asset and liability&#13;approach that requires the recognition of deferred 
tax assets and liabilities for the expected future tax consequences of 
events&#13;that have been recognized in the Company&amp;#146;s financial 
statements or tax returns. A valuation allowance is established to 
reduce&#13;deferred tax assets if all, or some portion, of such assets will more
than likely not be realized. Should they occur, the 
Company&amp;#146;s&#13;policy is to classify interest and penalties related to
tax positions as interest expense. Since the Company&amp;#146;s 
inception,&#13;no such interest or penalties have been incurred. The Company did
not record an income tax provision during the periods presented&#13;due to net 
taxable losses.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2013-01-01to2013-12-
31">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;The&#13;Company recognizes income taxes on an accrual basis based on 
tax positions taken, or expected to be taken, in tax returns. A tax&#13;position
is defined as a position in a previously filed tax return or a position expected
to be taken in future tax filing that&#13;is reflected in measuring current or 
deferred income tax assets and liabilities. Tax positions are recognized only 
when it is&#13;more likely than not (i.e., likelihood of greater than 50%), 
based on technical merits, that the position would be sustained 
upon&#13;examination by taxing authorities. Tax positions that meet the more 
likely than not threshold are measured using a probability-weighted&#13;approach
as the largest amount of tax benefit that is greater than 50% likely of being 
realized upon settlement. Income taxes&#13;are accounted for using an asset and 
liability approach that requires the recognition of deferred tax assets and 
liabilities for&#13;the expected future tax consequences of events that have 
been recognized in our financial statements or tax returns. A 
valuation&#13;allowance is established to reduce deferred tax assets if all, or 
some portion, of such assets will more than likely not be realized.&#13;No 
provision for income taxes was recorded during the periods presented because the
Company had a net taxable loss. Should they&#13;occur, our policy is to classify
interest and penalties related to tax positions as interest expense. Since our 
inception, no&#13;such interest or penalties have been 
incurred.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:DiscontinuedOperationsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2014-01-
01to2014-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0; text-align: justify"&gt;The results of the Company&amp;#146;s oil and&#13;gas
and mineral assets are being reported as discontinued operations as a result of 
the sale of the oil and gas properties in February&#13;2013 and the sale of the 
Company&amp;#146;s subsidiary which controlled various mineral leases and claims
in December 2013. Certain&#13;amounts reported in the prior periods presented 
have been reclassified to conform to the current period financial statement 
presentation.&#13;These reclassifications have no effect on previously reported 
net income (loss).&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:DiscontinuedOperationsPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:DiscontinuedOperationsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2013-01-
01to2013-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;The&#13;assets and financial results of the Company&amp;#146;s oil and
gas and mineral assets are being reported as discontinued operations&#13;as a 
result of the sale of the oil and gas properties in February 2013 and the sale 
of the Company&amp;#146;s subsidiary which controlled&#13;various mineral leases
and claims in December 2013. Certain amounts reported in the prior periods 
presented have been reclassified&#13;to conform to the current period financial 
statement presentation. These reclassifications have no effect on previously 
reported&#13;net income (loss). See &amp;#147;Note 3. Discontinued 
Operations&amp;#148; for a summary of the amounts reclassified for the 
periods&#13;presented herein.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:DiscontinuedOperationsPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2014-01-01to2014-
06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;The Company presents both basic and diluted&#13;earnings per 
share (&amp;#147;EPS&amp;#148;) amounts. Basic EPS is calculated by dividing net
income (loss) by the weighted average number&#13;of common shares outstanding 
during the period presented. Diluted EPS amounts are based upon the weighted 
average number of common&#13;and common equivalent shares outstanding during the
period presented. Potentially dilutive shares of common stock consisted 
of&#13;warrants to purchase shares of common stock (8,200,000 shares as of June 
30, 2014 and December 31, 2013) and options to purchase&#13;shares of common 
stock (135,000 shares as of June 30, 2014 and 80,000 as of December 31, 2013). 
During the periods presented, potentially&#13;dilutive shares of common stock
were not included in the computation of dilutive loss per share as to do so 
would be anti-dilutive.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2013-01-01to2013-
12-31">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify; text-indent: 0pt"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;/font&gt;The&#13;Company presents both basic and diluted 
earnings per share (&amp;#147;EPS&amp;#148;) amounts. Basic EPS is calculated by
dividing net&#13;income (loss) by the weighted average number of common shares 
outstanding during the period presented. Diluted EPS amounts are&#13;based upon 
the weighted average number of common and common equivalent shares outstanding 
during the period presented. Potentially&#13;dilutive shares of common stock 
consisted of warrants to purchase shares of common stock (8,200,000 shares for 
2013 and nil shares&#13;for 2012) and options to purchase shares of common stock
(80,000 shares for 2013 and nil shares for 2012). During the 
periods&#13;presented, potentially dilutive shares of common stock were not 
included in the computation of dilutive loss per share as to do&#13;so would be 
anti-dilutive.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock>
    <rcar:RelatedPartyTransactionsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2014-01-
01to2014-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0; text-align: justify"&gt;A related party is generally defined as (i)&#13;any 
person who holds 10% or more of the Company&amp;#146;s securities and their 
immediate families; (ii) the Company&amp;#146;s management;&#13;(iii) someone 
who directly or indirectly controls, is controlled by or is under common control
with the Company; or (iv) anyone&#13;who can significantly influence the 
financial and operating decisions of the Company. A transaction is considered to
be a related&#13;party transaction when there is a transfer of resources or 
obligations between related parties. See &amp;#147;Note 6. Related 
Party&#13;Transactions,&amp;#148; for further 
discussion.&lt;/p&gt;</rcar:RelatedPartyTransactionsPolicyTextBlock>
    <rcar:RelatedPartyTransactionsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2013-01-
01to2013-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;A&#13;related party is generally defined as (i) any person who holds 
10% or more of the Company&amp;#146;s securities and their 
immediate&#13;families; (ii) the Company&amp;#146;s management; (iii) someone 
who directly or indirectly controls, is controlled by or is under&#13;common 
control with the Company; or (iv) anyone who can significantly influence the 
financial and operating decisions of the Company.&#13;A transaction is 
considered to be a related party transaction when there is a transfer of 
resources or obligations between related&#13;parties. See &amp;#147;Note 7. 
Related Party Transactions,&amp;#148; for further 
discussion.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</rcar:RelatedPartyTransactionsPolicyTextBlock

    <us-gaap:IntangibleAssetsDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2014-01-
01to2014-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0; text-align: justify"&gt;On July 12, 2013, the Company, together with&#13;its 
wholly owned subsidiary, RenovaCare Sciences, entered into an asset purchase 
agreement with Dr. J&amp;#246;rg Gerlach, MD, PhD,&#13;pursuant to which 
RenovaCare Sciences purchased all of Dr. Gerlach&amp;#146;s rights, title and 
interest in the Cell Deposition Device.&#13;The Company plans to further the 
development of the Cell Deposition Device, if commercially viable, bring the 
product to market.&#13;Pursuant to the terms of the Asset Purchase Agreement, 
upon the closing of the transaction, the Company paid Dr. Gerlach 
$100,002&#13;and issued to Dr. Gerlach a Series A Stock Purchase Warrant (the 
&amp;#147;Series A Warrant&amp;#148;) entitling him to purchase 
1,200,000&#13;shares (each a &amp;#147;Warrant Share&amp;#148;) of the 
Company&amp;#146;s common stock, subject to vesting milestones through July 
11,&#13;2019, at an exercise price of $0.35 per share. Acquisition related costs
amounted to $52,852 and were capitalized together with&#13;the cash payment. 
Additional costs capitalized during 2013, and which related to a wound cap 
technology, amounted to $10,000. No&#13;additional costs were capitalized during
2014. At June 30, 2014, intangible assets amounted to 
$162,854.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Series A Warrant was issued
in exchange&#13;for services to be rendered in the future by Dr. Gerlach. An 
additional agreed upon cash sum amounting to $300,000 will be paid&#13;to Dr. 
Gerlach upon the Company attaining certain milestones related to the 
Regeneration Technology. The value of the Series A&#13;Warrant will be 
recognized as consulting expenses to the Company over the vesting term of the 
underlying warrant, subject to Dr.&#13;Gerlach providing ongoing consulting 
services to the Company with respect to the Regeneration Technology. As such, 
the measurement&#13;date for accounting purposes will be the date on which 
performance by Dr. Gerlach is completed. The fair value of each 
Warrant&#13;Share is estimated at the end of each reporting period during which 
Dr. Gerlach renders services using the Black-Scholes option&#13;pricing model. 
The fair value of each Warrant Share was approximately $0.79 as of June 30, 
2014. Assumptions required for the Black-Scholes&#13;model are as 
follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent:
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 
100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: 
#CCEEFF"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-
size: 10pt"&gt;Weighted average risk-free interest 
rate&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 9%; text-align: 
center"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt"&gt;1.62%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-
align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Expected life in 
years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: 
center"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;5.00 
Years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: 
bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Weighted Avg Expected 
Volatility&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: 
center"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt"&gt;90.9%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-

justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Expected dividend 
yield&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: 
center"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt"&gt;0%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify;
text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Consulting 
expense associated with the Series&#13;A Warrant amounted to $68,500 and 
$195,333 during the three and six months ended June 30, 2014.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:IntangibleAssetsDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:IntangibleAssetsDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2013-01-
01to2013-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;On July&#13;12, 2013, the Company, together with its wholly owned 
subsidiary, RenovaCare Sciences, entered into an asset purchase 
agreement&#13;with Dr. J&amp;#246;rg Gerlach, MD, PhD, pursuant to which 
RenovaCare Sciences purchased all of Dr. Gerlach&amp;#146;s rights, 
title&#13;and interest in the Cell Deposition Device. The Company plans to 
further the development of the Cell Deposition Device, if 
commercially&#13;viable, bring the product to market. Pursuant to the terms of 
the Asset Purchase Agreement, upon the closing of the transaction,&#13;the 
Company paid Dr. Gerlach $100,002 and issued to Dr. Gerlach a Series A Stock 
Purchase Warrant (the &amp;#147;Series A Warrant&amp;#148;)&#13;entitling him to
purchase 1,200,000 shares (each a &amp;#147;Warrant Share&amp;#148;) of the 
Company&amp;#146;s common stock, subject to&#13;vesting milestones through July 
11, 2019, at an exercise price of $0.35 per share. Acquisition related costs 
amounted to $52,852&#13;and were capitalized together with the cash payment. 
Additional costs capitalized during 2013, and which related to a wound 
cap&#13;technology, amounted to $10,000. At December 31, 2013, intangible assets
amounted to $162,854.&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The Series&#13;A Warrant was
issued in exchange for services to be rendered in the future by Dr. Gerlach. An 
additional agreed upon cash sum&#13;amounting to $300,000 will be paid to Dr. 
Gerlach upon the Company attaining certain milestones related to the 
Regeneration Technology.&#13;The value of the Series A Warrant will be 
recognized as consulting expenses to the Company over the vesting term of the 
underlying&#13;warrant, subject to Dr. Gerlach providing ongoing consulting 
services to the Company with respect to the Regeneration Technology.&#13;As 
such, the measurement date for accounting purposes will be the date on which 
performance by Dr. Gerlach is completed. The fair&#13;value of each Warrant 
Share is estimated at the end of each reporting period during which Dr. Gerlach
renders services using the&#13;Black-Scholes option pricing model. The fair 
value of each Warrant Share was approximately $0.87 as of December 31, 2013. 
Assumptions&#13;required for the Black-Scholes model are as 
follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif;
width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="width: 75%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 25%;

Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;2013&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr 
style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF"&gt;&#13;

    <rcar:CommonStockOptionsTextBlock contextRef="From2014-01-01to2014-06-
30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Approval&#13;of the 2013 Long-Term Incentive 
Plan&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;On&#13;June 20, 2013, the 
Board of Directors (the &amp;#147;Board&amp;#148;) adopted, subject to receiving
shareholder approval, the 2013 Long-Term&#13;Incentive Plan (the 
&amp;#147;Incentive Plan&amp;#148;). The Incentive Plan provides for the 
issuance of stock options of up to 20,000,000&#13;shares (subject to adjustment)
of the Company&amp;#146;s common stock to officers, directors, key employees and
consultants of the&#13;Company. Options granted to employees under the Incentive
Plan, including directors and officers who are employees, may be 
incentive&#13;stock options or non-qualified stock options; options granted to 
others under the Incentive Plan are limited to non-qualified&#13;stock options. 
On November 15, 2013, shareholders owning a majority of the Company&amp;#146;s 
issued and outstanding shares approved&#13;the Incentive 
Plan.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;Incentive Plan is 
administered by the Board or a committee designated by the Board. Subject to the
provisions of the Incentive&#13;Plan, the Board has the authority to determine 
the officers, employees and consultants to whom options will be granted, the 
number&#13;of shares covered by each option, vesting rights and the terms and 
conditions of each option that is granted to them; however,&#13;no person may be
granted in any of the Company&amp;#146;s fiscal year, options to purchase more 
than 2,000,000 shares under the Incentive&#13;Plan, and the aggregate fair 
market value (determined at the time the option is granted) of the shares with 
respect to which incentive&#13;stock options are exercisable for the first time 
by an optionee during any calendar year cannot exceed $100,000. Options 
granted&#13;pursuant to the Incentive Plan are exercisable no later than ten 
years after the date of grant.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify;
text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;exercise price per 
share of common stock for options granted under the Incentive Plan will be the 
fair market value of the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;common stock on the date of 
grant, using the closing price of the Company&amp;#146;s common stock on the 
last trading day prior to&#13;the date of grant, except for incentive stock 
options granted to a holder of ten percent or more of the Company&amp;#146;s 
common&#13;stock, for whom the exercise price per share will not be less than 
110% of the fair market value. No option can be granted under&#13;the Incentive 
Plan after June 20, 2023.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent:
0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;As&#13;of June 30, 2014, 
there were 19,865,000 shares available for 
grant.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Stock&#13;Option 
Activity&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;On&#13;August 1, 2013, the 
Company granted to each of Messrs. Kirkland and Sierchio 20,000 stock options. 
The exercise price per share&#13;is $0.65; 10,000 options vested on the grant 
date and, subject to continued service as a member of the Company&amp;#146;s 
Board, the&#13;remaining 10,000 options will vest on August 1, 2014 and may be 
exercised on a &amp;#147;cashless basis&amp;#148; using the formula 
contained&#13;therein.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Effective&#13;December 1, 
2013, the Company appointed Mr. Bold as its President &amp;#38; CEO and entered 
into an at-will consulting agreement (the&#13;&amp;#147;Consulting 
Agreement&amp;#148;) with Mr. Bold. Pursuant to the terms of the Consulting 
Agreement, Mr. Bold was issued a stock&#13;option to purchase up to 40,000 
shares of the Company&amp;#146;s common stock (the &amp;#147;Option 
Shares&amp;#148;) at a price of $0.75&#13;per share the closing price of the 
Company&amp;#146;s common stock as quoted on the OTCQB on November 29, 2013. The
Options Shares&#13;may be exercised on a &amp;#147;cashless basis&amp;#148; 
using the formula contained therein and, subject to Mr. Bold&amp;#146;s 
continued&#13;service as the Company&amp;#146;s President and Chief Executive 
Officer, the Options Shares vest as follows, 20,000 on: (a) December&#13;1, 
2014; and (b) December 1, 2015.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify;
text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;On&#13;April 1, 2014, the 
Company appointed Ms. Patsy Trisler as its Vice President &amp;#150; Clinical

agreement (the &amp;#147;Trisler Consulting Agreement&amp;#148;) with Ms. 
Trisler. Pursuant to the terms of&#13;the Trisler Consulting Agreement, Ms. 
Trisler was issued Option Shares to purchase up to 50,000 shares of the 
Company&amp;#146;s common&#13;stock at a price of $1.05 per share, the closing 
price of the Company&amp;#146;s common stock as quoted on the OTCQB on April 1, 
2014.&#13;The Options Shares may be exercised on a &amp;#147;cashless 
basis&amp;#148; using the formula contained therein and, subject to Ms. 
Trisler&amp;#146;s&#13;continued service as the Company&amp;#146;s Vice 
President &amp;#150; Clinical &amp;#38; Regulatory Affairs, the Options Shares 
vest as follows,&#13;10,000 on: (a) April 1, 2015; (b) April 1, 2016; (c) April 
1, 2017; (d) April 1, 2018; and (e) April 1, 
2019.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman,

style="vertical-align: bottom; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;  
&lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="vertical-align:
bottom; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif"&gt;5,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="vertical-align: 
bottom; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&
lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;fair value of each 
stock option is estimated at the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option 
pricing model. The weighted-average&#13;fair value of stock options granted 
during 2013 was approximately $0.49 to $0.57 per share. The weighted average 
fair value of&#13;stock options granted during 2014 was $1.05 per share. 
Assumptions regarding volatility, expected term, dividend yield and risk-
free&#13;interest rate are required for the Black-Scholes model. The volatility 
assumption is based on the Company&amp;#146;s historical experience.&#13;The 
risk-free interest rate is based on a U.S. treasury note with a maturity similar
to the option award&amp;#146;s expected life.&#13;The expected life represents 
the average period of time that options granted are expected to be outstanding. 
The assumptions for&#13;volatility, expected life, dividend yield and risk-free 
interest rate are presented in the table 
below:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 
100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: 
#CCEEFF"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 82%; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Weighted average risk-
free&#13;    interest rate&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 
18%; text-align: center"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;1.43 &amp;#150; 1.62%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr 
style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;Expected life in years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="text-align: center"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif"&gt;4.50 &amp;#150; 5.50&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr 
style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;Weighted Avg. Expected Volatility&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13; 
&lt;td style="text-align: center"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif"&gt;99.5%&amp;#160;&amp;#150; 
105.3%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: 
bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;Expected dividend yield&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="text-align: center"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif"&gt;0%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify;
text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;During&#13;the three and six
months ended June 30, 2014, stock-based compensation expense of $12,573 and 
$19,355, respectively, was recognized&#13;as general and administrative 
expenses. There were 20,000 stock options vested and 115,000 unvested, as of 
June 30, 2014. As of&#13;June 30, 2014, the Company had $55,387 of total 
unrecognized compensation cost related to unvested stock options, which is 
expected&#13;to be recognized by April 1, 
2019.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0; 
text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;The Company issues new shares when options are 
exercised.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</rcar:CommonStockOptionsTextBlock>
    <rcar:CommonStockOptionsTextBlock contextRef="From2013-01-01to2013-12-
31">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Approval&#13;of the 2013 Long-Term Incentive 
Plan&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;On June&#13;20, 2013, the 
Board of Directors (the &amp;#147;Board&amp;#148;) adopted, subject to receiving
shareholder approval, the 2013 Long-Term&#13;Incentive Plan (the 
&amp;#147;Incentive Plan&amp;#148;). The Incentive Plan provides for the 
issuance of stock options of up to 20,000,000&#13;shares (subject to adjustment)
of the Company&amp;#146;s common stock to officers, directors, key employees and
consultants of the&#13;Company. Options granted to employees under the Incentive
Plan, including directors and officers who are employees, may be 
incentive&#13;stock options or non-qualified stock options; options granted to 
others under the Incentive Plan are limited to non-qualified&#13;stock 
options.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The Incentive&#13;Plan is 
administered by the Board or a committee designated by the Board. Subject to the
provisions of the Incentive Plan, the&#13;Board has the authority to determine 
the officers, employees and consultants to whom options will be granted, the 
number of shares&#13;covered by each option, vesting rights and the terms and 
conditions of each option that is granted to them; however, no person&#13;may be
granted in any of the Company&amp;#146;s fiscal year, options to purchase more 
than 2,000,000 shares under the Incentive Plan,&#13;and the aggregate fair 
market value (determined at the time the option is granted) of the shares with 
respect to which incentive&#13;stock options are exercisable for the first time 
by an optionee during any calendar year cannot exceed $100,000. Options 
granted&#13;pursuant to the Incentive Plan are exercisable no later than ten 
years after the date of grant.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The exercise&#13;price per 
share of common stock for options granted under the Incentive Plan will be the 
fair market value of the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;common stock on the date of 
grant, using the closing price of the Company&amp;#146;s common stock on the 
last trading day prior to&#13;the date of grant, except for incentive stock 
options granted to a holder of ten percent or more of the Company&amp;#146;s 
common&#13;stock, for whom the exercise price per share will not be less than 
110% of the fair market value. No option can be granted under&#13;the Incentive 
Plan after June 20, 2023.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;As of December&#13;31, 2013,
there were 19,920,000 shares available for 
grant.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Stock&#13;Option 
Activity&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;On August&#13;1, 2013, the 
Company granted to Messrs. Kirkland and Sierchio (20,000 stock options each) for
stock options granted on August&#13;1, 2013. The exercise price per share is 
$0.65; 10,000 options vested on the grant date and, subject to continued service
as a&#13;member of our Board, the remaining 10,000 options will vest on August 
1, 2014. The Options Shares may be exercised on a 
&amp;#147;cashless&#13;basis&amp;#148; using the formula contained 
therein.&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Effective&#13;December 1, 
2013, we appointed Mr. Bold as our President &amp;#38; CEO and entered into an 
at-will consulting agreement (the &amp;#147;Consulting&#13;Agreement&amp;#148;) 
with Mr. Bold. Pursuant to the terms of the Consulting Agreement, Mr. Bold is 
expected to serve on a part-time&#13;basis and will receive an annual fee of 
$50,000, payable in 12 equal installments, which is prorated for any partial 
months during&#13;the term of the Consulting Agreement. In addition to Mr. 
Bold&amp;#146;s fee, he was issued a stock option to purchase up to 
40,000&#13;shares of our common stock (the &amp;#147;Option Shares&amp;#148;) at
a price of $0.75 per share the closing price of our common stock&#13;as quoted 
on the OTCQB on November 29, 2013. The Options Shares may be exercised on a 
&amp;#147;cashless basis&amp;#148; using the formula&#13;contained therein and, 
subject to Mr. Bold&amp;#146;s continued service as our President and Chief 
Executive Officer, vest as follows:&#13;(a) 20,000 Options Shares vest on 
December 1, 2014; and (b) 20,000 Options Shares vest on December 1, 
2015.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times,

Serif"&gt;9.50&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
nowrap="nowrap"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: 
right"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;
$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;6,800&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
nowrap="nowrap"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&
lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The fair&#13;value of each
stock option is estimated at the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option 
pricing model. The estimated weighted-average&#13;fair value of stock options 
granted during 2013 was approximately $0.49 to $0.57 per share. Assumptions 
regarding volatility,&#13;expected term, dividend yield and risk-free interest 
rate are required for the Black-Scholes model. The volatility assumption&#13;is 
based on the Company&amp;#146;s historical experience. The risk-free interest 
rate is based on a U.S. treasury note with a maturity&#13;similar to the option 
award&amp;#146;s expected life. The expected life represents the average period 
of time that options granted&#13;are expected to be outstanding. The assumptions
for volatility, expected life, dividend yield and risk-free interest rate 
are&#13;presented in the table below:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 
100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="width: 75%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 25%; 
border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;2013&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr 
style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF"&gt;&#13;    
&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Weighted 
average risk-free interest rate&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="text-align: center"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif"&gt;1.43 &amp;#150; 1.49%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr 
style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    
&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Expected 
life in years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: 
center"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;5.0 
&amp;#150; 5.5 Years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr 
style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF"&gt;&#13;

Avg Expected Volatility&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-
align: center"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;99.5% - 103.4%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr 
style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;

dividend yield&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align:

$0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New
 Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;During the&#13;year ended December 31, 2013, stock-
based compensation expense of $15,440, was recognized as general and 
administrative expenses.&#13;There were 20,000 stock options vested and 60,000 
unvested, as of December 31, 2013. There was no stock compensation expense 
recognized&#13;in 2012. As of December 31, 2013, the Company had $27,317 of 
total unrecognized compensation cost related to unvested stock 
options,&#13;which is expected to be recognized by December 31, 
2015.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The Company&#13;issues new 
shares when options are 
exercised.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</rcar:CommonStockOptionsTextBlock>

<rcar:NoncashInvestingAndFinancingActivitiesNoteReceivedOnDisposalOfSubsidiary 
contextRef="From2012-01-01to2012-12-31" unitRef="USD" xsi:nil="true" />
    
<rcar:NoncashInvestingAndFinancingActivitiesNoteReceivedOnDisposalOfSubsidiary 
contextRef="From2013-02-20to2013-12-31" unitRef="USD" xsi:nil="true" />
    <us-gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2013-
01-01to2013-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;On February&#13;18, 2013, we completed the sale of our working 
interest in the Onnie Ray #1, Haile #1, Pearce #1 and Stahl #1 oil wells. We 
entered&#13;into an Assignment Agreement with Leexus Oil LLC, the wells 
operator, whereby the Company assigned its right, title and interest&#13;in the 
oil, gas and mineral leases and the oil and gas wells. Consideration for the 
assignment was the assumption of all outstanding&#13;liabilities and assumption 
of all future payments for any and all work performed on the 
wells.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;On February&#13;19, 2013, we
completed the sale of our working interest in the Cooke #6 well. We entered into
an Assignment Agreement with Millennium&#13;Petro-Physics, the well operator, 
whereby we assigned the right, title and interest in the oil, gas and mineral 
leases and the&#13;oil and gas wells. Consideration for the assignment was 
$3,000 cash.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The carrying&#13;amount of 
the oil and gas properties was $24,127 on the date of disposal. The related 
asset retirement obligation amounted to&#13;$57,532 and liabilities assumed 
amounted to $12,932. Including the $3,000 cash received, the Company recognized 
a gain of $49,338&#13;in the year ended December 31, 2013, as a result of the 
disposal.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font:
10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;On December&#13;31, 2013, we
entered into a stock purchase agreement with Duke, pursuant to which we sold to 
Duke 100% of the issued and outstanding&#13;shares of Fostung Resources, a 
wholly owned subsidiary of ours, for a promissory note in the amount of $80,000,
which amount approximated&#13;the fair value of the leases and mining claims 
controlled by Fostung Resources, as concluded by an independent third-party 
geological&#13;consultant. Principal and interest at 4.0% are payable on 
December 31, 2015. Including the $80,000 of consideration received,&#13;the 
Company recognized a loss on the disposal of the subsidiary of 
$453,581.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The 
Company&amp;#146;s&#13;revenue reported in discontinued operations for the years
ended December 31, 2013 and December 31, 2012 were $nil and 
$16,549,&#13;respectively. The Company&amp;#146;s net loss reported in 
discontinued operations for the years ended December 31, 2013 and 
December&#13;31, 2012 was $(404,243) and $(14,420), respectively. The Company 
has not recognized any revenue nor incurred expenses with respect&#13;to its 
previously owned oil and gas and mineral assets since their respective sales, 
and will not recognize any continuing cash&#13;flows with respect to these 
properties in the future.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,

    <us-gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2013-01-01to2013-12-
31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;There is&#13;no current or 
deferred tax expense for 2013 and 2012, due to the Company&amp;#146;s loss 
position. Realization of the future tax&#13;benefits related to the deferred tax
assets is dependent on many factors, including the Company&amp;#146;s ability to
generate taxable&#13;income within the net operating loss carryforward period. 
Management has considered these factors in reaching its conclusion as&#13;to the
valuation allowance for financial reporting purposes and has recorded a full 
valuation allowance against the deferred tax&#13;asset. The income tax effect, 
utilizing a 34% income tax rate, of temporary differences comprising the 
deferred tax assets and&#13;deferred tax liabilities is a result of the 
following at December 31:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width:

Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&
lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The 2013&#13;increase in the
valuation allowance was $155,000 (2012: 
$81,000).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The Company&#13;has 
available net operating loss carryforwards of approximately $5,961,000 for tax
purposes to offset future taxable income which&#13;expires commencing 2014 
through to the year 2033. Pursuant to the Tax Reform Act of 1986, annual 
utilization of the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;net operating loss carryforwards may 
be limited if a cumulative change in ownership of more than 50% is deemed to 
occur within&#13;any three-year period. The tax years 2010 through 2013 remain 
open to examination by federal agencies and other jurisdictions&#13;in which it 
operates.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;A reconciliation&#13;between
the statutory federal income tax rate (34%) and the effective rate of income tax
expense for the years ended December&#13;31 
follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New

      </tr>

<TEXT>
/* Updated 2009-11-04 */
/* v2.2.0.24 */
/* DefRef Styles */
..report table.authRefData{
background-color: #def;
border: 2px solid #2F4497;
font-size: 1em;
position: absolute;
}
..report table.authRefData a {
display: block;
font-weight: bold;
}
..report table.authRefData p {
margin-top: 0px;
}
..report table.authRefData .hide {
background-color: #2F4497;
padding: 1px 3px 0px 0px;
text-align: right;
}
..report table.authRefData .hide a:hover {
background-color: #2F4497;
}
..report table.authRefData .body {
height: 150px;
overflow: auto;
width: 400px;
}
..report table.authRefData table{
font-size: 1em;
}
/* Report Styles */
..pl a, .pl a:visited {
color: black;
text-decoration: none;
}
/* table */
..report {
background-color: white;
border: 2px solid #acf;
clear: both;
color: black;
font: normal 8pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
margin-bottom: 2em;
}
..report hr {
border: 1px solid #acf;
}
/* Top labels */
..report th {
background-color: #acf;
color: black;
font-weight: bold;
text-align: center;
}
..report th.void {
background-color: transparent;
color: #000000;
font: bold 10pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
text-align: left;
}
..report .pl {
text-align: left;
vertical-align: top;
white-space: normal;
width: 200px;
word-wrap: break-word;
}
..report td.pl a.a {
cursor: pointer;
display: block;
width: 200px;
overflow: hidden;
}
..report td.pl div.a {
width: 200px;
}
..report td.pl a:hover {
background-color: #ffc;
}
/* Header rows... */
..report tr.rh {
background-color: #acf;
color: black;
font-weight: bold;
}
/* Calendars... */
..report .rc {
background-color: #f0f0f0;
}
/* Even rows... */
..report .re, .report .reu {
background-color: #def;
}
..report .reu td {
border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}
/* Odd rows... */
..report .ro, .report .rou {
background-color: white;
}
..report .rou td {
border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}
..report .rou table td, .report .reu table td {
border-bottom: 0px solid black;
}
/* styles for footnote marker */
..report .fn {
white-space: nowrap;
}
/* styles for numeric types */
..report .num, .report .nump {
text-align: right;
white-space: nowrap;
..report .nump {
padding-left: 2em;
}
..report .nump {
padding: 0px 0.4em 0px 2em;
}
/* styles for text types */
..report .text {
text-align: left;
white-space: normal;
..report .text .big {
margin-bottom: 1em;
width: 17em;
}
..report .text .more {
display: none;
}
..report .text .note {
font-style: italic;
font-weight: bold;
}
}
}
..report .text .small {
width: 10em;
}
..report sup {
font-style: italic;
}
..report .outerFootnotes {
font-size: 1em;
}

      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_AssetRetirementObligation">
        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>The carrying amount of a liability for an asset retirement 
obligation. An asset retirement obligation is a legal obligation associated with
the disposal or retirement of a tangible long-lived asset that results from the 
acquisition, construction or development, or the normal operations of a long-
lived asset, except for certain obligations of lessees.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: 
none;">

http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br><br> -Publisher FASB<br><br> 
-Name Accounting Standards Codification<br><br> -Topic 410<br><br> -SubTopic 
20<br><br> -Section 50<br><br> -Paragraph 1<br><br> -Subparagraph (c)<br><br>

Obligation<br><br> -URI

          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>Amount of a reclamation liability that is associated with a 
legal obligation for the closure and reclamation of oil and gas properties.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: 
none;">
                <p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br><br> -Publisher FASB<br><br>
